How can an app be this terrible? Have your developers never seen the apps that competitors provide? I have a potato in my kitchen that I will be using from now on, as it is a legitimately better app than this one is.

title: Disappointed New Eero User
text: Set up. First speed test sitting next to router is good. 400 range.  I tried Speedtest and Fast. Moved to the other end of my place (I have 1100 sq ft total over two floors) Both speed tests drop to double digits and don’t speed back when near the router. Endless restarting of modem and router to get speed back. Ended up reconnecting AirPort Extreme. While not as fast next to the router, it maintains the speed the further away you go. What a disappointment. They say, 1500 sq feet away and I was probably 800 sq ft away.

title: Networks need to be in alphabetical order
text: For someone who has over 100 clients, it is extremely time consuming switching between networks when there is not easy way to search for network names. Why are they not in alphabetical order OR a search function? I’ve heard they used to be in alphabetical order but an update changed that? Why? There needs to be an update to fix this.

title: Great but app is not so great
text: I have had these eeros since last Christmas and they are spectacular but I have noticed the app is not it is slow to respond and overall just a slow app but a couple improvements could make it the greatest WiFi Booster

title: Excellent Wi-Fi system!
text: I love my eero Wi-Fi system, I check and manage my network from anywhere, the app is easy to use, I always have a signal throughout my house and my devices never freeze. For me it is a great network, that’s why I give them a perfect rating.

title: Very happy
text: We purchased the Eero system after switching our ISP account. Set-up was easy and trouble free and the coverage in our home is great. The system is much better than what we were previously using purchased through Century Link.

title: They ruined the app...
text:
This used to be a great app. It just worked  and allowed you to easily view and monitor your network. 

After the most recent update, 3.17, you can no longer see all items on the network along with their real time data use. Arguably the most valuable feature of the app was removed! To call this frustrating is an understatement. 

They’ve complicated something for no good reason and reduced the utility of the product. The app has regressed.

title: 6.0.1 Bugs Galore - Significant
text:
App v6.0.1 still doesn’t resolve the wired vs Wi-Fi device indicators.

Firmware 6.0.2 doesn’t fix bugs introduced in 6.0.1...still resulting in flaky 2.4ghz connections, wired devices show up as not connected in the app, when they of course are connected and issues when moving from one satellite to the next-2 or 5 ghz. Turning off “Frustration-Free Setup” and also turning off Band Steering helps ameliorate the issues, but doesn’t solve everything. A lot more QA testing is needed here. 👎🏼

title: Good hardware, too many upsells
text: The core service is good but the app has annoyances which only show up if you don’t subscribe to their optional security service, which isn’t worth the money. For example, you can see the weekly network usage summary for a device  but not daily or weekly or your historical internet speeds because they withheld that from non subscribers.

title: Latest app update went downhill
text: Parental controls used to allow you to see whose internet is paused just by looking at the color of the profile. If it’s grey, the profile is on pause. Otherwise it’s on. The latest refresh of the app had to go out of its way to disable that and show number of device that’s paused. Why??

title: Needs iPad support/info on updates
text: I really like my Eero system and accompanying app, however it would be really beneficial to have a dedicated iPad app. I’d also like the app to show when the router/network has been updated as well as the release notes for those updates. Besides these 2 requests I love everything about my Eero system.

title: Horrible UI experience after version 3.0
text:
This review is about the app. I used to like the app.  It was simple to see all the connected devices and their upload/download activity all in a single page. 

Now you must open each device detail page to see this information and it’s also inaccurate (while older version 2 was accurate, verified with device’s OS network tools).  I cannot easily tell which of my 20+ devices is the one using the bandwidth. 

Why break an app that was decent for the sake of a new UI concept?  

Also we have been asking for years for a web interface to access/control the router from the intranet side but you keep denying us this.  Why can’t you?

title: Eero wifi
text: The app makes setup easy. I installed a Eero Pro 3 piece system to replace a Apple Extreme and two Airport Expresses. The Apple system would push about 50 Mbps. The Eero shot up to 144 and 243 Mbps. I now have have a 1 gig from Xfinity and my wifi on iPad and iPhone is as high as 292 Mbps. Super system that doesn’t fluctuate speed much. No rebooting either!

title: Once a fan, now useless trash
text: I was an early customer of eero and, regretfully, recommended them to many other. They slowly added pay-per-month features and annoying upsells while limiting functionality without a subscription. Annoying, but manageable. Now, however, you cannot even access your own routers without signing in to an account on their system. Unacceptable. Especially for something like a router.

title: Worse App In The App Store
text: This is by far the worse app in the app in the App Store. It doesn’t even keep you logged or it doesn’t even offer an option to stay signed in (always, 30 days, or sign out auto after closing app). The app doesn’t even offer to login with Face ID. Doesn’t respond to well, the updates for the actual hardware update without notifications, so if you are working on something you better get use to saving a lot LOL! 1 star.

title: App update is final straw
text: I’ve been using eero roughly 2 years now. I still find it to be the best mesh solution but the lack of features needed limited my use of it. Now the app update has literally locked me out of over 90 of my installs due to the fact you cannot scroll when switching networks. This has basically turned into networking aol. It is only for people that want to plug and play the simplest possible solution with no ability to customize. Good luck eero. I’m done.

title: Awesome product
text:
Eero was the only device to give me solid wifi throughout my 1930's Brooklyn apartment. The hardware works like a charm and the software is simple and just works. And keeps getting better with updates. Thank you!

Wishlist: being able to sort the order of my list of Eeros

title: Setup issues
text: After getting a reply from developer I am going to attempt the set up again. They really need to put detailed instructions in the box about how to get around roadblocks and that you need to turn off the WiFi if you have a router/ modem combo. I’m having the same issue as one of the previous reviewers. There are only 3 steps on the card in the box. And how are you supposed to set this up with no internet connection?

title: 5* network, 2* app
text: I am very satisfied with the coverage and signal of my Eero Pro 6 routers, but they seem to left the “pro” out of the app.  For the pro version of these routers, I wish there was the option of utilizing more advanced features.  At an absolute minimum, there should be a web interface so that you can configure using a computer instead of a phone app only.

title: So far so good
text: Replaced Nighthawk router.  So far so good, about the same speed, love the app and seeing all wifi devices connected.  I would love to be able to check if a device uses Wifi 6 protocol - not sure if that is technically feasible.

title: Great system, no historical usage stats
text:
I like my eero Pro 6 system. The app is fine. The only complaint is that you get very poor stats on usage unless you pay for eero Secure every year. 

You do get to see the current week’s usage but that rolls over on Sunday so the historical data for the past week are gone. Other routers give you this for free.

title: Steady service updates and a rock solid app.
text: I just got the update that allows me to pause individual devices. Thank you! This is exactly the sort of thing that pushed me to buy an eero in the first place. I’m very happy with the service and the app.

title: Awesome
text: I have three EERO systems. Two at two different large work locations and one at my home with is a three story home built in 1905. It is rock with plaster walls and nothing has worked well.  Mesh network of EERO is the only system has ever worked well. I get 100mb down in all areas of house.  Great product.

title: Setup Didn’t Work Right
text:

If it wasn’t for Reddit and other User forums I wouldn’t have gotten this working at all. What should have taken minutes took over three hours.

title: Demands money for your data?

title: parenting

title: Just OK

title: Not impressed
text: Can’t say if the product works well because the interface is awful. Gives customers one choice: an app. If you have trouble you can call tech support, if they’re around. Calling after 5pm? title: Countdown timed pause

title: Redesign is a step back

Worst is that in 2019 Eero still doesn’t report on data usage patterns. Which device is consuming my data? When? Who is using the most data in the house? Even routers provided by ISPs are offering this type of useful information.

I don’t see a lot of value to the reports on scans, etc. particularly since they don’t derive any actionable information. 

Please Eero, focus on the right problems.

title: Terrible software
text: It’s no good having all these pods when your device will keep trying to connect to the furthest one. These clowns have not figured out how to make the eero recognize which pod has the best connection and getting you on that one. I can be sitting right by a pod and instead of latching on it the phone keeps trying one that’s on the other side of the house, meanwhile the WiFi can’t connect due to that distance and there’s no way to override with the app. Lousy system

title: iPad support, logging needed
text: Overall, a great app for a great product. My only wish would be for an iPad version with responsive design. Glad the push notifications came to the product to indicate new systems on the network. I’d really appreciate the ability to view logs for things like blocked content, DHCP offers and NAT routing.

title: The Best of Firm and Function
text:
Simple the best system I’ve owned and worked with. 

Ran it in parallel to a commercial system at home, it easily won out. 

The marriage of form and function make it a perfect solution for home users. 

The application delivers rich features not found in more expensive solutions. 

The ability to hardwire the mesh is a great feature for those looking to maximize performance. 

I’ve told family and friends I’m happy to help if the are using a eero system, if not I’ll help them install one. 

Much appreciation, exceeded expectations!

title: App works well just one thing missing.
text: The one thing that is missing IMO is that when you pull up the connected devices details you can’t see what connection standard it is (WiFi a,b,g,n,ac,ax)(WiFi 1,2,3,4,5,6). You can see band and security but not wifi standard.

title: Easy set up and good wifi  speed
text: I am not very tech savvy, so I appreciated eero’s easy, step-by-step illustrated instructions when I opened the app. The wifi speed was better than the dual band router I previously used. Thank you!

title: Doesn’t seem to do anything
text: The app has access to Bluetooth on my phone, but cannot find the arrow device that it is sitting directly on top of. It’s a nice idea to be able to manage network with an app, but would be even nicer to be able to manage it on my laptop, given that it has a larger screen, keyboard, etc. And of course, an app isn’t very useful if it can’t connect to the device.

title: Slow to update local network
text: The app is just fine to manage devices and see what’s on your network but if you have one of the mesh routers turn offline it can take several minutes before it appears online again.  They seem to rely too much on their cloud services where it would be better to interact locally with the devices or give us more troubleshooting data.

title: Great units, downgraded app.
text: Good coverage and convenient in most ways, but not being able to manually test current speed when the old version of the app used to be able to do so is a clear downgrade of an extremely basic feature. Also the new layout is clunky and needlessly cluttered. It used to be everything at a glance, now its a bunch of useless tabs. The app should be reverted to its original version.

title: Give me throttle control
text: Working good so far.  Able to keep the teenager from keeping up all night.  Just need to be able to throttle profiles.  The teenager consumes the vast majority of our limited bandwidth and would like to share it evenly within the household.

title: Great system, mediocre app
text: Just added a Beacon to my system to cover a bedroom with poor signal and discovered that the app doesn’t actually have controls for the nightlight. Had to delete and reinstall the Beacon to turn the darn thing off. Also, 98% of what this app does is encourage you to buy eero plus (but then, so do 98% of all communications from eero).

title: App used to be so much better
text: everything you needed was on one screen, now its this confusing mess, try to run a speed test? used to be a button on the first screen, now its hidden somewhere. The app also no longer shows you if your internet is down, it happily gives you the ‘all clear’ while your internet is dead as a doornail... whish I could downgrade to the old app which worked nicely...

title: Rock stable with frequent updates
text: 5 Eero’s over a couple years without problems.  Very easy install.  Very easy to add devices.  Works with so many companies.  VPN is nice to have also.  Would recommend

title: App UI horrific, finally got rid of eero
text: New app is absolutely terrible. I was all in with eero from the very start. Even got family on it. As of 2/2 I’m completely done with eero and eero+. The new app is the most unusable app I’ve got. Because it was never fixed I canceled eero+ and replaced all eero decided with another mesh option. eero performance also seemed to be significantly worse lately. Too bad they ruined their product. Waste of my money.

title: I used to live eero
text: Ever since 3.0 I think, the app completely changed, I can’t find any of my devices now. All of the settings have moved.  It’s not an intuitive interface at all anymore. Very disappointed! Still love my eero network but the app is garbage now which makes the total experience much less desirable since the app is the only way to interface with the eero network. Please fix this!

title: Terrible experience
text: I swear our connection got worse as soon as RCN installed this. On top of that, the app itself is unhelpful. When clicking the “Check Eeros” button on the homepage, it says my internet is offline. When I then click the internet link, it says, “online” and that my internet is super fast. Of course, when I run the speed test, it says I’m offline. I’ve had a terrible experience with Eeros.

title: Problem with buffering using Roku
text:
Spoke with Nick from eero. He determined that my eero 6 devices were working properly and the buffering was due to Spectrum issues.
He also assured me that the fact the closest eero satellite was not the one supplying the signal to my Roku device was not of concern.

title: Decent, but stop upselling
text:
This is not a review of the eero devices, this is a review of the eero app.

It’s pretty well done, and it has a good balance of technical/understandable guidance when setting up eeros.  It does sometimes feel like I have to dig down into tons of menus to get to what I want, but it’s not often that I have to do that.

Overall, though, the app has a good breadth of advanced settings and things that you would want to be able to do with your router.

The one thing that’s super annoying, is the occasional upselling of eero plus.  No, I don’t want it.  No, I don’t need it.  Stop trying to sell it to me.  This alone deducts two stars.

title: Speed test inaccurate
text: I find the speed test to be inaccurate. The eero app says I’m running 30 mbps. So I use my third party speed test app and it’s nearly less than half of what the eero sppes tests reads. I’ve done this numerous times and have come to conclusion that this app is inaccurate. I just bout the eero router 5 days ago and I’m ready to move on and change my router to Google/Nest router.

title: 5 stars!! Best app ever
text: I have no idea why it's three stars in appetite. This App is fantastic! User-friendly, and all features are there. Nothing is missing and no bugs. It's so unfair. Please, DO NOT believe in this three stars rating!

title: HuH??
text:
Upon updating my iPhone and iPad to iOS 14 and iPadOS 14 respectively and my Apple Watch to WatchOS 7, the eero app “thought” that I had purchased new, all of the above, devices(?).  Now, I have two of each of the above devices listed; the old and the new. 

What gives?

Also, I am Not able to delete the “OLD” devices from the list, only “Block” the old devices. When blocked, the devices still remain on the list as blocked devices.

I like the three eero routers, however the app needs Fixing regarding the above problems.

title: Setup is extremely frustrating
text: When everything's all set up the eero is great and works perfectly fine but setting it up is honestly a nightmare. You can put a eero next to the router/ modem and it takes forever for it to connect and when you move it to another room it disconnects. Its really tedious and time consuming...

title: Just doesn’t work
text:
The latest update is totally glitchy in my iphone 11. The help menu does not work, the app can’t find existing eero networks nore gateways, it even says that my email is incorrect and i registered more than a year ago.

Total disappointment. Loved my eero network but lately is just not working and the customer service is as laggy as the app. Can’t reach to a real person to help me.

title: Quite good
text: The layout and menu are simple at use, and quick to register. There are plenty of ways to annoy your family.

title: Eero Routers are great, the app not so much
text:
We have multiple Wifi routers and they provide great service throughout the house. 

The app could provide basic networking stats, troubleshooting help, browser access  like some other reviewers have commented.

title: Horrible Customer Support
text:
Recent update completely dropped off the nightlight function. I sent a specific email to support regarding this issue and the response was a copy+paste generic “here is where you can find that function”.

When I pointed the absolute zero help of this, the only response was to ask what version of the app I was using, and then nothing but a “thank you”.

title: New app
text: Eero itself works awesome. I don’t have any problems, but taking away features with new app versions is frustrating. I loved when I could open the app and see the top devices consuming bandwidth. I have almost 80 devices and this was a feature I used all the time. If they bring this back it’s 5 stars for you.

title: App is good but ads ANNOYING
text:
I’m pretty disappointed that an app for a multi hundred dollar product throws huge ads in my face whenever I run it. 

It would be enough to say no once, or MAYBE twice, but to have to continuously dismiss the ad for the Eero Plus service is terrible. I would feel differently if this was a cheap product, but I paid big bucks already for the router.

title: Could be 5 stars, big flaw, kids can get around controls
text: Eero lacks the ability to block new devices from getting online so as soon as kids figure out how to change a MAC address, the system is useless in controlling access.  Please creat MAC address control, or secondary SSID that would have limited access times and different passwords.  Look elsewhere if you want a system that will actually help you control access times.

title: Couldn’t get it to install
text:
I live where there is no cell service. When trying to install/configure the app, I couldn’t get it to work. We have a fiber line to the building with a static ISP, but I could never get the settings to “take”. I think it (absurdly) needs internet access in order to setup internet access. (I worked in IT for 20 years.)

Sending the hardware back and uninstalling.

title: Scheduled pause doesn’t work properly
text: I have two scheduled pauses for during the weeks I my kids don’t stay online all day but it keeps shutting down during the weekends and at night. Getting so frustrated. Tried deleting the scheduled pauses and adding them again but it never works properly. I gave up a great router cuz I expected more out of the Eero but I am very disappointed in the app.

title: New eero
text: Easy setup, kept Internet name and password the same and all my devices connected. WiFi speed is just as fast as signal coming in.

title: Update Needed!
text: Please add the ability to delete blocked/no longer needed connections from the app!!!  Organization freaks like me need the ability to keep the list clean is important!!  Thx!

title: Doesn’t work and war always customer support
text: Wasted $500!  Followed directions.  App will not install.  Install program feeezes up.  Unit blue light solid suggesting a connection but no connection.  Try to call customer service good luck.  As I write this review I have been on hold for 20 minutes.  Try another nesting product.  I will be returning mine for a refund.  My time is worth something.  Disappointed.

title: I HATE THE NEW APP
text: Why did you change the app? It’s horrible. Less functionality with a terrible design. I run my eero’s in bridge mode. Before I could name devices and see signal strength. Now previously named devices remain, but I can’t edit the names of new ones. You have the best WiFi devices, why roll out a trashy app? Also, someday it would be nice to enter an IP address in a browser as opposed to an app on a phone. I expect more!

title: Why fix something that was not broken
text:
The updated app is slow to refresh connected devices (or not displaying at all).  
Why do I need to expand the menu in order to see all my APs every single time?
 “Run speed test” not responding.
What up with the greenish GUI when the icon is blue and other lingering blues throughout the App?
Come on, why fix something when it wasn’t broken.

title: Won’t stop asking me about Simple Setup
text:
Every time I open the app it asks me again whether I want to upgrade to “Frustration Free Setup”. No matter how many times I dismiss, it keeps coming back. 

No; I didn’t find much of anything to be frustrating before this Phoenix of a prompt arrived. I hope the irony is not lost on the app developers.

title: Great App
text: App does what it says and does it without issues for me. Would be great if they could add “Camera” as a device type for digital cameras that are wifi-enabled.

title: Manual updating
text: You guys should make it to where there is a notification when there is an update instead of automatically doing it but as an option because the internet cuts out to update at crucial moments

title: Good overall but bug in speed test
text: I love the Eero router and app overall. Getting good coverage with no dead spots throughout my house. But the speed test feature in the app has to be called for what it is - a sham. Last 15-20 measurements have all returned identical readings. 117Mbps download and 12Mbps upload. Unimplemented feature with numbers hard coded by programmer?

title: New look
text: Not bad but would like to put devices into the right categories as your new update does a poor job of it!

title: Can’t verify phone number.
text: It just keeps telling me that the phone number is invalid. Tried another number and the same thing. Tried deleting the app and reinstalling. No dice. App need another update or something. Need to get past this glitch.

title: Really!
text: Ever since the update my app keep logging me out when I haven’t logged out. And why can’t this app have a control pause for your Wi-Fi? However if they a fix this problem with the app logging you out, this would be great.

title: Best Wi-Fi App
text: My internet went from 5-10 Mbps to at least 50 Mbps for all my devices. The app allows you to keep track of all Apple and other devices. 10/10

title: App in very unstable
text: Often checking the app while connected to the network will bring down the entire network. Checking it while using cell service is fine. Network was completely stable for well over a year until the new app came out.

title: Disappointing UX refresh
text: My biggest issue is that the app tries to “categorize” the connected devices into groups (Computers, entertainment , “other”) and consistently guesses wrong. If as a developer you know that’s the case either don’t implement the feature or let me disable or override it. I was fine with a list sorted alphabetically because I took the time to name devices the way it made sense to me.

title: Glad to have add eero back
text: I spent about 30 minutes yesterday trying to find the add eero prompt, with little help from the faq and support pages. I found it by accident. Just glad to see it back.

title: Is there an update coming for latest IOS?
text: Worked great but appears to need an update. Chrome is saying certificate issue.

title: Good for legacy formats but not 4K or 8k
text: The coverage is great should you be able to afford the numerous devices depending on square footage and materials in your house. I needed six devices for complete coverage. However, I wish the video streaming was better quality. When streaming 4K there is a lag and often pixel discrepancies noticeable on the screen. Wish I was advised when investing in this system.

title: App still doesn’t work right
text: I left a review 3 weeks ago stating that the app keeps logging me out. I received a reply from the developer stating to update the app, which I did right away. The app still logs me out at least once a day. While I like the hardware, the app issue is extremely frustrating.

title: Interface
text: While the product is great, the interface has just really gone bad. As an IT installer the “switch network” function is a nightmare. What is the method of listing? How about alpha? Or add a search field? A simple diagnostic for a client now requires a research and callback. Please address!

title: Great routers, but no HomeKit support yet.
text: I love my eero Pro 6 routers, but after months of use  I am still not seeing support for Apple’s HomeKit. Eero claims it’s been waiting for certification from Apple since Nov ‘20. OTOH I’m not aware of any other routers that are certified for WiFi 6, either.

title: Love our Eero but watch out for wake up alarms.
text: There are certain smart alarms that interfere with the Eero. If you are having the same issue I did with connecting beacons, unplug the smart alarm and wahwlah.

title: Pretty basic
text: Works well for simple home setup, but advanced features are not very advanced.  They seem to be trying to find a balance between user friendly and technically capable, which leaves a bit to be desired for the latter.

title: Version 3.0.0 is slow
text:
New app, new interface, new problems.
I never saw a big issue with the out layout, but...
I cant really review the new look and organization because the app is soooooo slow over cellular. I am hoping when I am home on the network that it picks up and this poor remote connection is a fluke.

title: No issues for me
text: I’ve had eero for about 10 months now and I haven’t had any issues. Was easy and fast to set up.

title: Crashes too often
text: You would think as often as their routers lose the WAN side of the network they would add facial recognition to their app so I don’t have to type all my credentials every other day. Even better add the ability to login on the LAN side so I don’t have to turn the WiFi off on my phone to get the internet to login to my local router.

title: No eero secure plus in the discover options
text:
I see it listed in the app as being there but it is not there for me for some reason.  

Other than that it works great.  I def want some eero secure plus though in the app.

title: Offline error message
text: Lately the app kept saying my system is offline and there was no internet connectivity. The WiFi name was also different. I removed the app and reinstalled it. It’s now working again.

title: Great Network
text: Best home network I’ve ever had. 400mbps all day long and great WiFi coverage. Thank you for fixing the app and APs with the last update. Keep it up!

title: PLEASE FIX THIS
text: Set up a 3-piece system for parents. Now I can’t explain to them why the words "eero secure trial is active" won’t stop disappearing and reappearing on this app’s home screen every 2 seconds. Uninstalled and reinstalled the app - no change. Same behavior on iPhone 12 & iPhone 8. PLEASE FIX.

title: App needs a password option
text: Wish there was an ability to password protect the app, so my kid doesn’t change the settings on the schedule or unpause their devices when they’re using my phone.

title: Good product terrible app
text: The coverage is great at my home. 3 eeros, wired backhaul. Get around 400mbps up and down. The app is now terrible. The version before this “all new” one was ok but the revamped one is garbage. It’s not setup logically at all. The team that created it failed. Scrap it and go back to the old one.

title: Finally! Usage reports are available
text: Good app but eero needs to add a way to manage your network without using a mobile app. A web interface or desktop app is needed.

title: Please bring back old Eero UI
text: The new Eero app UI is far inferior to the previous UI. Color scheme is confusing, quick look to what is going on with speeds etc, and even most used devices is gone. Please bring back a check mark to use old UI or “legacy” mode.

title: Immediately buggy
text: Update broke the app. Tons of errors and bugs from the moment the app asks you to log in. Once in, the interface has been redesigned completely. And it is change for the sake of change. The new interface has a much less appealing aesthetic and has less ergonomic flow. In general I’m quite sick of app redesigns that cheapen the product.

title: Intuitive App that is missing basic functionality
text:
This app is easy to use and understand and eero does a great job at making making a mesh network reliable and seamless to set up.

Where they fall short is in missing basic functionality in their app such as historical network traffic, profiles that aren’t simply time based but could include other conditions.

It appears with the simplicity of a router setup, you get just that, simple.

I love the hardware and I love what’s currently in the app and the way it functions. I do not like that my router doesn’t seem as customizable as an older cheaper router would be.

title: Excellent
text: A couple things not intuitive, but worked flawlessly once I got my head on straight.

title: Ok I guess
text:
I’m honestly not sure what the purpose of this app is. 
One thing I’d like to do is use it to report outages. I’ve had two today of a couple minutes each. Not worth picking up the phone for, but they did interrupt my work.

title: Horrible new iOS app version (3.x.x)
text: Things looked great and clean before this new release. Now this feels like a completely new app, with crucial features gone. Please don’t make me tap three times in the menu to see how much my devices are doing. It was so nice to see the activity in ONE SCREEN for ALL the devices. Sorry guys. Eero as a wireless router is 5 star. This new app is 1 star, and that’s being generous.

title: Pro Installer Problem
text: I have about 50 accounts and version 3.0 does not allow you to scroll on the Switch Networks page. iPhone and iPad apps are both affected.

title: New app is not good
text: The new app is horrible - slow, verification failed several times, said my phone number wasn’t valid.  The new interface is poorly structured and SLOW to load - loading device detail is taking 5-10 seconds each device. The prior Eero app was lightning fast and well laid out -this isn’t.  Keep the old app till they fix this.

title: No Web Interface

I would give it 0 stars if I could stop being special and have a web interface like every other router ever

title: No issues
text: I don’t know why all the negative reviews. I have no issues with the eero app. Gets better with every update.

title: Returning the items
text: Stuck on “looking for eero device”. Tried every possible thing from reading Reddit and other forums where people experience the same issue, nothing works. Not worth the time and nerves. Returning the items back and going for Google Nest. Very unpleasant overall experience. Was so excited at first to be just disappointed

title: Works Fine
text: New Eero user so I still have somewhat of a learning curve.  Took a couple days to figure things out, but everything seems t be working fine.

title: Latest version of the app.
text: What happened to this app? Unfortunately a completely functional application has received a major change. I won’t go in to details, just read the hundreds of reviews that pretty much cover it.

title: Whack-a-mole w/ new users 🤬👎
text: Thanks for getting “switch networks” to work for all of my networks. Still need to be able to label users 👍 and eliminate all “new” users from interface. title: Non-functioning redesign

title: Eero is so good I never need the app!
text:
Eero is so good I never need the app!

I don’t have to open the app to restart the bases when Eero gets slow because EERO DOESN’T GET SLOW!! It just works.

title: Latest update
text: I don’t know what you did with the latest update but my system now my devices now are slower to load if they do. Everything was working great before no delay whenever a browser window was opened up or a application to check on a camera. Rebooting the eero seems to be a short term fix.

title: Best router, app keeps getting worse
text: Instead of building on existing functionality, app loses some with every new release while adding a few new features that don’t quite work as intended.

title: Great router ... upselling app, not great
text: The router and satellite mesh beautifully. But the app is now removing features (like viewing speed history) for non-subscribers. title: Something Wrong

title: Latest version is severely broken

title: New UI is not as efficient

title: App is generally great, but...

title: New. Version Not Finished - Missing Functionality
text:

title: Love the app normally, but lately just crashes at start

title: In Love With Eero, But New App Interface Couldn’t Be Worse

title: Great product, upsell thirst unbearable

title: Really good from RCN

title: Love our Eero

title: Constantly Asks User To Upgrade

title: Liking the New App

title: Active time limit

title: Awesome

title: eero solved my buffering issues

title: Can’t restart router without internet connection
